meanings.definition: To freeze or chill (food or other items) before the final freezing process.
meanings.sent1: I always prefreeze the berries before making smoothies.
meanings.sent2: It is important to prefreeze the meat to preserve its freshness.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally prefroze the ice cream, making it too hard to scoop.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement prefroze her in place, unable to move.
meanings.sent5: The cold wind prefroze the puddles, turning them into ice rinks.

meanings.sent1: Prefreeze is a common practice in food preparation.
meanings.sent2: The prefreeze of the vegetables helps maintain their nutrients.
meanings.sent3: The sudden prefreeze of the lake caught the fishermen off guard.
meanings.sent4: The prefreeze of emotions before the big announcement was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The prefreeze of winter brought a blanket of snow to the town.
